title: Throw exception on missing lexicon entry
message:
Throw exception on missing lexicon entry

Previously, if a lexicon entry could not be found in
LexiconDetailFragment#onCreate(), the resulting exception was caught and
a message was written to the Android log. mLexiconEntry remained null,
causing a later exception. A NullPointerException will now be thrown in
this scenario, so we will hopefully receive bug reports from users when
errors happen here going forward.

This is obviously a less than optimal way to deal with this bug.
Long-term, we need to add automated testing to find and fix lexicon
parsing problems. It would also be nice to catch and gracefully handle
errors of this sort, propmting the user to submit a bug report, rather
than crashing.

See bug #148.

title: Optimize imports in LexiconDetailFragment.java
message: Optimize imports in LexiconDetailFragment.java

title: Fix crash caused by null activity reference
message:
Fix crash caused by null activity reference

LexiconDetailFragments were retaining a reference to their parent
activities. These could become null at some points in the application
lifecycle, causing exceptions when they were deferenced in
onPrepareOptionsMenu(). getActivity() is now used rather than a retained
reference to the activity. Fixes #150.

title: Fix a crash when rotating screen
message:
Fix a crash when rotating screen

Fixes #142. It looks like getActivity() was sometimes returning null
on screen rotation because the parent activity had been destroyed and
not yet recreated. We now save a reference to the activity in
onAttach(). Unfortunately I can't reproduce this bug, so I can't verify
with certainty that this will fix it, but I think this will do the
trick.

title: Improve handling of text size preference
message:
Improve handling of text size preference

Preference changes are now handled via a callback in the GreekTextView
class. The text size can now be fixed at medium by setting the
allowTextSizeChanges attribute to false in GreekTextView XML layouts.
This functionality is used to prevent the text size from changing in
ListView items.

title: Add typeface preference
message:
Add typeface preference

Adds a preference allowing the user to choose between the Noto Serif and
Roboto typefaces on devices running SDK 21 or higher. Older devices
cannot use Roboto due to lack of support for polytonic Greek characters.
This commit also includes various improvements to the design of the
SettingsActivity and GreekTextView classes.

Closes #107.

title: Use "orth" instead of "key" for lexicon headings.
message:
Use "orth" instead of "key" for lexicon headings.

Addresses #65. This fixes the headings in the lexicon entries, but we're still
using the key values for lexicon lists. We need to either fix the original
text or modify the GRDBC to use orth values instead of key values.

title: Fix a lexicon parser crash.
message:
Fix a lexicon parser crash.

Fixes #64. The parser was crashing due to an empty "tr" element. The remaining
oddities in the text mirror the entry displayed on Perseus, with one
exception: the "key" value, which we use to display the entry heading, is
incorrect. We need to use the "orth" value instead. I have created issue #65
to track this bug.

title: Fix search suggestion ordering
message:
Fix search suggestion ordering

Prior to this change, we were sorting lexicon search suggestions by the
_id column. It turns out that the IDs don't always correspond to alphabetical
order, so we now retrieve and sort by the greekNoSymbols column instead.
